result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald A. McElvaney

defendant.name: McElvaney, Ronald A.
defendant.address: 4777 88th Avenue, c/o Kenosha County Detention Center, Kenosha, WI 53144

records.addlTxt: Judicial Pretrial - in court on November 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
JPTC adj from 10/19 to 11/10 @ 3pm on court's own motion; court unavailable on previously scheduled date

Defendant Ronald A. McElvaney appeared with Attorney Joseph Corcoran.  Defendant in custody by zoom from KCDC. Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the Prosecution.  Ronald A. McElvaney appeared by video means with Attorney.  Clerk JT  Minutes:    Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Scheduling Order

01:58 PM   State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman. Defendant Ronald A. McElvaney not in court. Attorney Joseph Corcoran appeared on behalf of the defendant.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: The clerk received an email today from sheriff's department stating that the DE is refusing to attend today's hearing. Discussion held. The Court stated at the last hearing that the Court would proceed with today's hearing if the DE refused to appear as he refused to appear at the competency hearing on 7/27/22.  State's witness sworn-in and testified:  Jenna G.  Court finds defendant is competent to proceed. This matter is referred back to intake for preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman. Attorney Joseph Corcoran in court on behalf of Defendant Ronald A. McElvaney who is in custody and does not appear.  Clerk: PU
  Minutes:  Court received a call from Conveyance stating DE is refusing to leave his cell to come to Court.  Court advises Atty Corcoran that the DE is required to appear at the next hearing or the hearing will proceed without him.  Competency hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Competency hearing on July 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Drew Lehman appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody via Zoom.  Atty Jos. Corcoran appeared in person on behalf of deft.  Report has been received which opines the deft is not competent at this time but is likely to become competent.  State concurs with the report.  Both deft and defense counsel concur with the findings in the report.  Court finds the deft is not competent at this time; committed to the Dept of Health.  No medication order is requested at this time.  Case is suspended.
WCS and DHS/MMHI have been notified of order for exam via email; certified copy sent to jail.
by DHS
Proposed Order for Comp Exam.

02:14 PM  
  Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody but no appearance in court w/ Attorney  Joseph Corcoran.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Referred to Br 3 for Competency hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 12:45 pm.  Bond is continued posted.  DE raises issue of competency.  Court orders comp exam.    jk

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Joseph Corcoran  kmk

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant Ronald A. McElvaney appears in person.  Clerk: PT
  SPD has not appointed counsel yet and DE states he is going on a hunger strike until he gets sent to a mental health facility.  DE also states he can't read the complaint because he is legally blind and appears agitated in court.  Court will notify the PD's office regarding today's hearing to expedite appointment of counsel.  Time limits are tolled for cause.  Status conference scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
Comply w/ sex offender registry.  No access to social media by any means.

02:30 PM  Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Brian Rolf.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on March 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.  $2500  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  kmk
and witness list filed by the State
